texts.content_text1: Upon completion of this module, participants will:
texts.content_text20:
Identify situations where ethical dilemmas may arise despite legal
compliance, particularly in cases involving vulnerable populations such as
children.
texts.content_text21:
Evaluate professional conduct through the lens of both legal obligations
and ethical standards, using real or hypothetical case studies.
texts.content_text22:
Describe the main international and European legal instruments that apply
in issues of privacy and confidentiality in cases of child victims of crime,
and
texts.content_text23: Apply relevant legal standards in legal cases involving children.
